oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Highlander Fling, Vol. 1, No. 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: First issue of Highlander Fling newsletter. Articles include "Bug-Wood Cutters in Washington," "Work Begins at Allardt," and "the N.R.A. and Southern Textiles.'

The Highlander Fling was the Highlander Folk School's newsletter. First published in December 1933, the Fling detailed activities and goings-on at Highlander was well as educational programs, articles from staff and participants, and calls to action.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Textile factories; Textile workers; Cotton textile industry; United States.
